title: Sanna (Inn)
text:
The Sanna is a river of <a href="Tyrol%20%28state%29">Tyrol</a>, <a href="Austria">Austria</a>, a <a href="tributary">tributary</a> of the <a href="Inn%20%28river%29">Inn</a>.
The Sanna is formed near <a href="Tobadill">Tobadill</a> by the confluence of the rivers
and
(, from <a href="Silvretta">Silvretta</a> and <a href="Paznaun">Paznaun</a>). It flows into the Inn at the small town of <a href="Landeck">Landeck</a>.
It is long. Its basin area is . The villages <a href="Pians">Pians</a> and <a href="Grins">Grins</a> are situated at its waterfront.
The <a href="whitewater">whitewater</a> river is used for <a href="kayaking">kayaking</a> and was the site of the 1996 world championships.
